It's the first thing I remember about life. Many years have passed but vinyl records have never abandoned me. And you? Have you ever listened to a vinyl record? With its unique sound and crackling that gives you butterflies. Have you ever plunged into the colours of the sleeves artwork? Have you smelled it? Music captures a unique taste, seductive. In \"Vinylmania\" the director guides us through the grooves of an object that has never lost its soul. He investigates what makes it so legendary in a world dominated by liquid music: Simple nostalgia? Possession? The search for an idenitity? A cry against the fast food music? The digital river that has no heart or soul, just ones and zeros...","poster_path":"/xCyC8wL9YFWn8XklohrQnquEfGN.jpg","media_type":"movie","adult":false,"original_language":"en","genre_ids":[99],"popularity":1.984,"release_date":"2012-01-01","video":false,"vote_average":6.0,"vote_count":10},{"backdrop_path":"/9LMbfbuD1iCXfbk3IfdrZCqb1pj.jpg","id":253332,"title":"Pulp: a Film About Life, Death \u0026 Supermarkets","original_title":"Pulp: a Film About Life, Death \u0026 Supermarkets","overview":"Pulp found fame on the world stage in the 1990s with anthems including ‘Common People’ and ‘Disco 2000’. 25 years (and 10 million album sales) later, they return to Sheffield for their last UK concert.
